election_record.label: New York 1820 State Senate, Middle District

overview.note: Clintonians were also listed as Administration ticket.

sub_unit.name: Four
sub_unit.note: William C. Bouck received 55 votes as William C. Buck.

sub_unit.name: New Berlin
sub_unit.note: The New York Statesman omits the 109 votes for William C. Bouck in New Berlin.

sub_unit.name: Columbia
sub_unit.note: John I. Miller received 1 vote as John Miller.
Joseph D. Monell received 1 vote as Jose D. Munell.

sub_unit.name: Delaware
sub_unit.note: Joseph D. Monell received 1 vote as Joseph C. Monell.

sub_unit.name: Cherry Valley
sub_unit.note: Ebenezer Wakeley received 7 votes as Ebenezer Blakeley.

sub_unit.name: Westford
sub_unit.note: Joseph D. Monell received 1 vote as Jos. D. Monell.
William C. Bouck received 1 vote as Wm. C. Bouck.

sub_unit.name: Thompson
sub_unit.note: The New York Statesman transposed the totals for William C. Bouck and Tilly Lynde.

election_record.reference: Original Election Certificate, Town of Wawarsing.
Orange County Patriot; or, the Spirit of Seventy-Six (Goshen, NY). April 10, 1820.
Orange County Patriot; or, the Spirit of Seventy-Six (Goshen, NY). May 1, 1820.
The New-York Columbian (New York, NY). June 6, 1820.
